page.title: 07FARMING CONTD
page.content: increase in Autumn when there is little nutrition in the grass and in winter the cattle are taken in. The milk yield tends to rise during this latter period of heavy concentrate feeding and the average annual yield per cow is 5432 litres. This milk is converted elsewhere and returned to the area as yoghurts,cheese,cream and milk.{HORTICULTURE}This is the main type of farming with tomatoes as the main crop. Most growing is under glass. Root crops are grown outdoors with potatoes,which can also be grown indoors being the greatest yield. While tomato growing is the main greenhouse activity,production is declining,giving way to new crops such as aubergines,celery and cucumbers but peppers,lettuce,beans,parsley and radishes are also grown. At one time many varieties of flowers were grown
